task.summary: Default task
Add initial project configuration files and user profile signal handling
Add initial Django app structure with models, views, and tests
Add initial Django app structure with models, views, and tests
Add initial Django app structure with models, views, and tests
Refactor file structure and add new assets for improved UI
Add SVG icons and README for Font Awesome usage
Add index.html and update login, register, and password reset templates with static URL handling
Add password reset functionality with custom forms and email templates
Set up comprehensive academics module, added migrations, templates, admin configurations, and support for attendance tracking.
Next Commit

feat(academics): Default latest semester in attendance, fix group assignment for new students
- In the student attendance detail view, if no semester is specified via URL, the view now defaults to displaying data for the latest available semester. - Corrected an issue in the student creation process where the new student's profile was not being associated with the selected student group.

feat(academics): Create substitution management page
Adds a new interface for managing faculty substitutions for scheduled classes.
This new page allows administrative users to: - Select a specific date using a date picker to view the class schedule. - For each scheduled class, assign a substitute faculty from a dropdown list. - View the currently assigned substitute for a class. - Cancel an existing substitution, making the slot available again.
The interface provides clear, inline forms for both assigning and canceling substitutions on a per-class basis.

feat(academics): Create substitution management page
Adds a new interface for managing faculty substitutions for scheduled classes.
This new page allows administrative users to: - Select a specific date using a date picker to view the class schedule. - For each scheduled class, assign a substitute faculty from a dropdown list. - View the currently assigned substitute for a class. - Cancel an existing substitution, making the slot available again.
The interface provides clear, inline forms for both assigning and canceling substitutions on a per-class basis.

feat: Implement nested collapsible sidebar menu
Refactors the sidebar generation to support a two-pane layout with nested, collapsible subgroups, improving UI organization and maintainability.
The previous single-pane accordion menu was becoming cluttered as more items were added. This change introduces a more organized and scalable navigation system based on the theme's original two-pane design.
Key changes: - **Centralized Menu Configuration:** The entire menu hierarchy, including main groups and nested collapsible subgroups, is now defined in `academics/registry.py`. This makes it easy to modify the sidebar from a single location without touching view decorators.
- **Updated Templatetag:** The `get_sidebar_nav` templatetag has been rewritten to read the new centralized configuration and build the complex nested data structure required for the new layout.
- **New Sidebar Template:** The `_sidebar.html` partial is updated to render the two-pane menu. The left pane (main menu) controls the content of the right pane (sub-menu), which now contains the collapsible sections.
This new structure improves the user experience by reducing clutter and makes future maintenance of the navigation menu significantly simpler.
